posts.post_content: This should probably just be an auto 5/5. The only people voting it down probably aren't qualified to vote or they enjoy voting down the number 1 no matter what it would be. 2 "weaker" versions of this eventually got restricted themselves ([Lion's Eye Diamond](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lion's Eye Diamond) and [Lotus Petal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lotus Petal)), at least for a while.

Posted By: Coillingclover (5/20/2010 6:33:31 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I started playing magic in early 1995. By that time, I've heard of Black Lotus every now & then from my friends.  
I wanted to buy one but, of course, it's too late to get one already. To think that it came out just more than a year and a half before i started buying & playing MTG.   
  
I don't think I'll live to see this card getting reprinted. Even a [Lotus Petal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lotus Petal) is hard to find nowadays. Well, at least i got four petals in my collection. Damn, where did i put that time machine of mine. :)
posts.html:
I started playing magic in early 1995. By that time, I've heard of Black Lotus every now & then from my friends.
I wanted to buy one but, of course, it's too late to get one already. To think that it came out just more than a year and a half before i started buying & playing MTG.

I don't think I'll live to see this card getting reprinted. Even a Lotus Petal is hard to find nowadays. Well, at least i got four petals in my collection. Damn, where did i put that time machine of mine. :)

When I tought a friend to play and he asked me what card I considered the best and I told him Black Lotus. We were at school and I showed him the card on my netbook at break. He said that it was very strange that a flower was the most valued and the best card.   
It is also strange that a flower is an aftifact. It is alive.  
5/5
